item.title: The Good Friday Agreement: A Personal Reflection on the Value of Peace over Brexit
item.description:
Sarah Kay, human rights lawyer As a teenager in the spring of 1998, I felt frustrated and stuck. I lived in a small house in West Belfast with my grandmother and a rotating group of cousins. My grandfather, an active member of the Republican movement, had died a few years earlier. I was lucky to spend summers traveling with my parents, who had custody of me, experiencing a world beyond our limited opportunities and ongoing conflict...
